name: eutrochium fistulosum
description: Hollow Joe Pye Weed, a member of the Aster family, does have a mostly hollow central stem and is the largest of the Joe-Pye weeds, making for easy identification. It also boasts a dark-purple to off-white central stemNative to the Eastern half of the US, Hollow Joe Pye Weed will surpass the Midwest-native Eupatorium maculatum by about 1'.Â  Also known as Tall Joe Pye Weed, Trumpetweed.
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
